other_tests.findings: Reduced circulating sFlt-1 levels, reduced proteinuria, and stabilized blood pressure without apparent adverse events to mother and fetus.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Circulating sFlt-1 levels were lowered in a dose-dependent fashion; pregnancy lasted for 15 and 19 days in women treated twice and 23 days in a woman treated 4 times.

other_tests.findings: After single treatment, plasma fibrinogen levels were reduced by 15-20% and returned to baseline within 24 hours.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No enduring changes in proteinuria were sustained post apheresis; levels of sFlt-1 rebounded in the days following treatment.
